Thin alternating colored lines (in my test, black and white) display differently across different operating systems. Here are 4 different screenshots made yesterday:
Windows 7 (Blair): http://geeksbynature.dk/bugs/repeating-linear-gradient/w7_1.png
Windows 7 (Asa): http://geeksbynature.dk/bugs/repeating-linear-gradient/w7_2.png
Linux (Blair): http://geeksbynature.dk/bugs/repeating-linear-gradient/lin.png
OS X (me): http://geeksbynature.dk/bugs/repeating-linear-gradient/osx.png

(remember to watch in full zoom, as zooming changes the outcome significantly)

The nightlies used were not exactly the same, but at most a few days apart. According to Asa, nothing had changed in the relevant code between them though, and at least on OSX, I see no change between the nightly from the 21st and today (25th).

It is not clear how the angled versions *should* look, but it seems to me that linux and OSX gets the horizontal and vertical versions right at least, while windows 7 fails on all accounts. I had expected better results on the 45deg angle as well.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Visit demo in Windows 7
2. Visit demo in Linux
3. Visit demo in OS X
4. Compare results
Actual Results:  
Three different renderings produced.

Expected Results:  
Same rendering produced.
